result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry Edward Pryor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not previously done so- pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of probation period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
If revoked, the Court ordered all financial obligations to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

Seek and maintain employment.
Participate in job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with minors R.B. or L.C., or Milwaukee United Scrapyard located at 3232 W. Fond Du Lac Ave. or 3632 W. Galena St.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Participate in Parenting counseling.

AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
Urine screens.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

timeConds.notes: With release for employment- STAYED until 7-13-15, 5p.m. Defendant instructed to report directly to the HOC.  Good time allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry Edward Pryor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Terry Edward Pryor in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Terry Edward Pryor in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Ronald Dague for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/12/15.
css
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MILWAUKEE UNITED SCRAP YARD, L.C. (9/29/98) AND R.B. (10/14/99).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Terry Edward Pryor in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Terry Edward Pryor in custody.  Katryna L. Childs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
